newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile upholds "The Last Temptation of Christ" ban.
newsitem.headline: Chile upholds "The Last Temptation of Christ" ban.

text.p: Chile's Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld an eight-year ban on the showing of Martin Scorsese's controversial film "The Last Temptation of Christ", saying it offended and insulted Christians.

The court unanimously rejected a decision by a state censorship board to lift the 1989 ban and accepted an appeal from rightist moral pressure group The Future of Chile that the film should not be screened in local cinemas.

"The film, whose exhibition has been authorised by the Council of Cinema Classification, shows the figure of Jesus Christ as distorted and humiliated and his honour appears seriously damaged," the court ruling said.
"It offends and insults those, like the plaintiffs, who base their faith in the persona of Christ, God and man, and lead their own lives based on this conviction."
Local news reports said Chile is the only Western country in which the film is still banned. It also remains banned in Madagascar, that country's government said last year.
